page.title: 02DEIGHTON A SUMMARY
page.content: {DEIGHTON}is a mixture of old and new housing,rented and freehold property;shops,clubs,schools,services and industry.It was once a small textile area as is evident by place-names like "Tenterhill" and "Sheepridge"-not forgetting the "Woolpack" pub.Another dominant feature is the old "Board School" built in 1876,well maintained with many original features,now used as a Youth and Community centre.The main housing is council built in the 1930's and 1950's.There is a little light industry in{DEIGHTON}and the Service industries like Lawrence Batley's large Cash and Carry warehouse,Elmsley and Collins Fruit and Vegetable Wholesale depot,a large timber works and Brockhole's Ford garage.There are playing fields attached to the High School and a small children's park.
